comment: One of the best professors in the journalism program. I would take him for every class if I could. Very funny and easy to talk to, actually teaches you how to work for the news.

He's overall an average professor. His grading criteria is very weird. For example, he complimented my paper and said I did amazing but, I made a minor mistake with citations and got a 78% on that assignment. He does not grade consistently. His feedback is usually thorough and he will go in your document and tell you what you need to change. 7.5/10
Make sure to communicate with this professor in a timely fashion.

By far my fave professor yet. I took him for a maymester and I actually LOVED going to class. He is very picky with grading but if you follow his exact instuctions you'll do great. Plus, he always explains his reasoning for why he docked points. Overall, I wished I could have taken him for a full semester.

Took Dr. Azriel for a maymester and he turned a super dense and boring research class into an interesting and humorous class. He is a tough grader but lots of easy homework to balance out your grade. Quizzes are prob the most difficult part of the class. Overall he is amazing and I would take him again!

Professor Azriel was great! I had him for Communication Law, Ethics, and Diversity and it was the first time this class was offered. His lectures were interesting and he really likes it when people participate more. He also gave us a study guide for the tests  and he gives good feedback on your assignments. I would definitely take hime again!

I took this class online over the summer, but it was very easy. Professor Azriel really works hard to make sure you understand all the concepts and gives you opportunities to improve. Material can  be very dry but not inherently difficult to understand. Tests were relatively easy and he gives substantial feedback.
I highly recommend this class if you are a Communications major. You learn how to right News Releases, PSA's, Fact Sheets, Pitch Letters, and Media Contact Lists. One of my favorite classes at KSU.
He is a great teacher, take him if you can!!! I enjoyed his class! Show up and do the assignments and you will get an A or B. He is a really nice person and genuinely cares about his students future!
Read, read, read. I studied like mad and had a hard time. He is a great teacher and always up for answering any kind of questions but the material can be difficult to get through.
I love this Professor, he makes class interesting and it is not redundant. He has a great personality as well!!!

Great professor. Although he can get a little snippy at times. The only downside to this class is the grading is based on VERY few points. There are no tests, just 3 writing assignments,& AP and grammar quizzes.The quizzes are only worth 6 or 8 points each. Each error is 1/3 of a point. You can only make 1 error to get an A on the 6 point quizzes.

Azriel is a very good professor. I took Media law with him and even if the material was a little dry, he explains things very well & is open to answer questions. I would & am going to take him again. Attendance policy is 4 absences and then points are taken
Really cool guy. He is real nice and makes time for his students. He really acts interested in his job and students. I would take him again!

I echo the raters below me. Azriel is one of my favorite professors. I didn't think I'd like Media Law, but he made it SO interesting - it became my favorite class last semester! Yes, it's challenging, but not unreasonable and he is very helpful, positive and clear. Definitely recommend taking him for any class he teaches!

Dr. Azriel is a professor that reminds you why higher education is great. He's intelligent, helpful, dedicated, kind, and knows what he is talking about! He makes his own powerpoints, creates his test, and is a professional. I loved what could have been a very boring class and I have him to thank for it. THANK YOU DR. AZRIEL!

He was a fantastic teacher.  Kept what could be a very boring media law class interesting.  I would take him again.  He makes sure you understand the material in a normal way, not some outrageous terminology that you can't comprehend.
Awesome teacher!! classes are short and homework is easy. He is funny and makes class go by fast! attendance is a must but most classes are cut short!
awesome prof! he makes class interesting & you learn a lot! you'll get an A if you do your work and go to class!

Very happy and energetic kind of guy.  He treats you like a friendly manager: he'll joke around with you and let you slide on some stuff, but he expects you to keep up with deadlines and at least TRY.  Overall very satisfied and plan to take more of his classes.

Azriel was good. Class was easy and the work load was manageable. Didn't use the book that often, but buy it anyway b/c he does reference it once in a while. Don't miss too many days and show him you are making a good effort in class. He's fairly entertaining at times. Definitely has his fave students.

He is by far my favorite teacher at KSU.  The material is challenging, but he always does his part to help with anything ambigious.  I would take any class he teaches.  Teachers like him are rare these days, don't miss out.

Professor Azriel was interesting enough to keep the class alive for the most part. His tests were not well put together making it difficult to answer many questions. He also does not offer extra credit. He wasn't bad, but he wasn't my favorite either.

Dr. Azriel is a true asset to KSU- I learned alot from him, and he made the material very easy to understand and interesting.  I would suggest him as a teacher to anyone.  He is funny and you can do well as long as you study.  Best Advice: Make sure you know the Cases Brief for good grades on the test and follow the study guides!

Dr. Azreil is amazing. He is by far one of the best teachers I have ever had. His grading is fair and accurate. Tests are pretty easy as long as you study and he tells you what will be on them. Assignments are easy and he goes over them with you one on one. He makes class exciting and enjoyable, even tho attendence is not manditory, Dr. Azriel rewa
